docs.snippet: Some women are choosing to defy medical advice and social convention after mastectomies, saying they would rather live without breasts than undergo more surgery.

headline.print_headline: Offered Breast Reconstruction, More Women Opt to ‘Go Flat’

docs.snippet: Aaron Rodriques’s affection for cockroaches, worms and other creepers has widened in adulthood to thoughts of what they can teach us about our fears and even our xenophobia.
Thursday: A roundup of new California laws, the death of Debbie Reynolds, and a lightsaber tribute to Carrie Fisher.

headline.main: California Today: With New Laws, What Will Change in 2017?

docs.snippet: Google-parent Alphabet Inc launched Allo, a messaging app that incorporates Google's search feature and a chatbot that uses machine learning to "improve" itself over time.

headline.print_headline: Google Launches Allo, Bets on AI to Spice Up Chats
headline.main: Google Launches Allo, Bets on AI to Spice Up Chats

docs.snippet: On Facebook and Twitter, on the phone and on the job, from living rooms to hair salons, Donald Trump's "Grab 'em by the p----" comment has unleashed a tsunami of stories from women sharing painful memories of sexual assaults.
In a head-spinning turn, Mr. Putin decided against actions recommended just hours earlier by Sergey V. Lavrov in response to American sanctions and expulsions.

headline.print_headline: Putin Will Forgo Matching Obama With Sanctions
headline.main: Vladimir Putin Won’t Expel U.S. Diplomats as Russian Foreign Minister Urged

docs.snippet: In “The Four-Dimensional Human,” the young British critic Laurence Scott ponders the ways technology is changing individuals and cultures.

headline.main: Multimediated Lives: An Erudite Tour of Digital Culture

docs.snippet: Uppercase headlines on Breitbart and other media that back Donald J. Trump announced that most polls were wrong and pro-Clinton vote fraud was rampant.

headline.print_headline: How the Pro-Trump Media Covered Election Day
